Title: Relates to a report on the adequacy, reasonableness and affordability of insurance products designed to pay for the future medical expenses of certain injured plaintiffs
Summary: Requires a review and report by the superintendent of financial services, in consultation with the office of court administration, on the adequacy, reasonableness and affordability of insurance products designed to pay for the future medical expenses of injured plaintiffs who receive a judgment or settlement for damages that include future medical expenses.
ActClause: AN ACT in relation to requiring a review and report on the adequacy, reasonableness and affordability of insurance products designed to pay for the future medical expenses of injured plaintiffs who receive a judgment or settlement for damages that include future medical expenses; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof
